  • Method Details

    • letterToAlphabetIndex

      private static int letterToAlphabetIndex​(char letter)
      This method first converts any character input to uppercase then gives its corresponding index in the array, alphabet
      Parameters:
      letter - A letter from the alphabet of type char
      Returns:
      The index of the input letter in the alphabet array

    • alphabetIndexToLetter

      private static char alphabetIndexToLetter​(int index)
      This method converts an index to its corresponding alphabet in the alphabet array
      Parameters:
      index - An index value
      Returns:
      The letter character for the index value

    • numberOfLetters

      private static int numberOfLetters​(java.lang.String message)
      This method gets the length of an array excluding " " characters
      Parameters:
      message - A message of String type
      Returns:
      The number of letters in the input string

    • printArray

      private static void printArray​(char[] array)
      This method prints out the characters in an array through iteration . Method has no return value.
      Parameters:
      array - An input character array

    • printKeyArray

      private static void printKeyArray​(int[] keyArray)
      This method prints out the integer keys in the keyArray separated by a ','. Method has no return value
      Parameters:
      keyArray - An input integer array

    • encryption

      public static void encryption​(java.lang.String messageToEncrypt)
      This method encrypts the inputted message and prints out the encrypted message. Method has no return value Method generates random n values(keys) for each letter in the string. The randomly generated keys are used to encrypt the message by shifting each letter forward by its respective n value
      Parameters:
      messageToEncrypt - A message of String type

    • decryption

      public static void decryption()
      This method decrypts a cipher text. Method has no input parameters not a return type. Method gets user input for cipher message, number of n values and value of each n It then decrypts each cipher letter using the n value for that letter by first obtaining the index of each cipher letter, moving its index back by n and putting the new index in the alphabet array to get the original letter
